alert.note: Alert for Mower (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 3:18PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact Mitchell, northern Floyd and western Mower Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 317 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Glenville to 6 miles east of Manly to near Rockford. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rockford around 320 PM CDT. St. Ansgar and Rudd around 325 PM CDT. Austin, Osage, and Lyle around 335 PM CDT. Stacyville and Floyd around 345 PM CDT. Rose Creek around 350 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include County Roads A 39 And S 70, Meyer, Toeterville, County Roads B 60 And T 18, Rock Creek, Idlewilde State Park, Otranto, Brownville, County Roads T 54 And A 31, and Highways 9 And 218. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 175 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central Iowa.
